alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:34PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Ada, southeastern Canyon and northwestern Owyhee Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 334 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Toy Pass, or 39 miles south of Nampa, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Swan Falls around 410 PM MDT. Initial Point around 420 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley
